SENT.plain: EEGs from 16 patients with stroke in three different stages of evolution were recorded
EEG sources were calculated every 0.39 Hz by frequency domain VARETA
The main source was within the delta band in 2 out of 4 chronic patients, and in 67% of the patients in the acute or subacute stages when edema (cytotoxic or vasogenic) was present
Moreover, all patients showed abnormal activity in the theta band
Sources of abnormal activity in cortical or corticosubcortical infarcts were located in the cortex, surrounding the lesion
At the site of the infarct, a decrease of EEG power was observed
Sources of abnormal theta power coincided with edema and/or ischemic penumbra
